wikipedia_page.main: William Sellar (21 September 1866 – 10 June 1914) was a Scottish footballer, who played for Queen's Park, Battlefield, Rangers and Scotland.

response: * 21 September – William Sellar (d. 1914), Scotland international in nine matches, scoring four goals (1885–1893).
|William Sellar (2), James Kelly, James Hamilton, own goal||12,000 ||

Whilst at Oxford, he joined the Corinthian amateur club, making his debut on 22 December 1888. He played intermittently over the next few years and his final appearance came on 21 March 1891 against a Scotland eleven. Scotland also played an official international against Wales on the same day as this match.Wales 3 Scotland 4; 21 March 1891 (Match summary) However, the match against Corinthians was treated as a practice for the match against England, and was considered more important than the game against Wales.SRCF match summary The Scots won the match 9–2 with four goals from Frank Watt, and two each from William Sellar and Davie Baird. All three were selected for the forthcoming England international, with Watt scoring a late consolation goal as England won 2–1.England 2 - Scotland 1; 6 April 1891 (Match summary)England 2 - Scotland 1; 6 April 1891 (Match summary)
